perturbation.changed_text:
13. SECURITY DEPOSIT

13.1 As per provisions of Clause 17 ("Conditions precedent"), and unless otherwise agreed by the Parties, the Company *may* pay a Security Deposit to the Repairer. The amount, if any, will be determined at the Repairer's sole discretion based on the Company's creditworthiness and payment history.

13.2 If a Security Deposit is deemed necessary by the Repairer, it *may* be constituted as follows, at the Repairer's discretion:
 (i) a cash deposit by SWIFT wire transfer to the bank account indicated in Clause 12.2 (iv); or,

 (ii) one (1) LOC with a validity determined by the Repairer. If an LOC is used, it may or may not need to be renewed, as decided by the Repairer. All costs, *if applicable*, will be borne by the Company.

It is agreed that a Security Deposit, *if required*, is non-refundable under any circumstances.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states that the Company *shall* pay a Security Deposit, creating a definite obligation. The modified clause changes this to *may*, making the payment discretionary. It also removes the clear process for calculation of the deposit, and states it is non-refundable under *any* circumstances contradicting potential refund scenarios mentioned elsewhere, creating uncertainty and favoring the Repairer. In the original agreement it also states that if the LOC is not renewed or extended as per the terms of Clause 13.2, the cash deposit shall become immediately due and payable and the Repairer shall be entitled to draw such LOC, in order for the Repairer to receive an amount equal to the Security Deposit. However, the modified text creates contradiction for that term.

The original clause enforces mutual confidentiality. The modification states confidentiality obligations only apply to the Repairer. The modified version allows the Company to share Confidential Information at will, creating an in-text contradiction regarding the scope of confidentiality. This creates uncertainty and favors the Company.

22. ASSIGNMENT

There are no beneficiaries of this Agreement other than the Parties hereto and their Affiliates and Subcontractors to the extent provided herein.
This Agreement shall be binding on the successors and permitted assignees of the Parties hereto.

a) This Agreement has been entered into between the Parties in consideration of and based on characteristics specific to the Parties. Consequently either this Agreement or any of the respective rights or obligations of the Parties hereunder may be assigned or otherwise transferred, in whole or in part, in any form whatsoever (including by way of change of Control), by either Party subject to the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed, and any attempt to do so without such consent shall be null and void.
perturbation.changed_text:
22. ASSIGNMENT

There are no beneficiaries of this Agreement other than the Parties hereto and their Affiliates and Subcontractors to the extent provided herein.
This Agreement shall be binding on the successors and permitted assignees of the Parties hereto.

a) This Agreement has been entered into between the Parties in consideration of and based on characteristics specific to the Parties. Consequently either this Agreement or any of the respective rights or obligations of the Parties hereunder may be assigned or otherwise transferred, in whole or in part, in any form whatsoever (including by way of change of Control), by the Repairer without the prior written consent of the Company. Any assignment by the Company requires the Repairer's consent, which may be withheld at the Repairer's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original states that the agreement or any of the rights/obligations may be assigned by either party with consent from the other party. The modification states Repairer can assign this agreement, however, an assignment can be blocked if Repairer does not want the assignment. This creates an in-text contradiction regarding the party's rights in assigning or making such transfer. It favors the Repairer.
